alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 9:39PM PST until December 12 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Polk and Benton Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especiallly if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 PM PST Monday the stage was 27.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:10 PM PST Monday was 27.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Monday night and continue falling to 11.3 feet Thursday, December 21. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 600 AM PST.
